Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso respectively nine and ten lines of a continuous text recording an appeal by the workman Qenna to the oracle of Amenhotep I, asking the god to decide between him and his fellow workman Merysekhmet, son of Menna.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: A. M. Blackman, 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 12 (1926), pp. 181-3, pls. 35, 36, 41; A.G. McDowell, 'Village Life in Ancient Egypt' (Oxford, 1999), p.177 [text134]; S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl. XII; J. Černy, , ‘Bulletin de l’Institut Français d’Archéologie Orientale’ 27 (Cairo, 1927), pp. 184-5; S. Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no. 21 pp.46-7; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' VI (Oxford 1983), 252-3; A. Theodorides, 'Revue d'Égyptologie' 21, p. 100.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136350) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136350)
